item.title: Report E-2024090407
item.description:
Report E-2024090407

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: SANTA ROSA BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 9, 2024, five (5) five-gallon pails of primer were dropped during unloading and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of primer to the asphalt. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from NRC Gulf Environmental Services, Inc. (NRC Gulf) to remediate the impacted site. NRC Gulf placed all damaged pails into seven (7) lined 55-gallon drums. Granular absorbents were placed onto all primer impacted areas. The crew swept up all loose absorbents with hand tools. A pressure washing system was used on all stained concrete and a vac truck was utilized to retain any loose water. All seven (7) waste drums were taken offsite and staged at the Milton, Florida R+L terminal. All waste water was taken with the crew to be disposed of on a later date.

item.title: Report E-2024090415
item.description:
Report E-2024090415

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-28
  • City: HIALEAH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 21:15 EST 8/28, XPO-NMF contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 qt of Isopropyl Alcohol from a 55-gallon metal drum. A forklift punctured the drum, spilling it on the NMF dock. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE. The damaged drum and cleanup debris were containerized in in 65-gallon poly drum which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WENT TO DOOR #6 IN THE UNLOAD, WET PACKAGES WERE FOUND ON THE GRATING. ONE OF THE PACKAGES HAD A DIMAOND HAZMAT LABEL AND MULTI-PART HAZMAT PAPERS. TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGES TO THE HAZMAT AREA AND PROCESSED USING SODIUM BICARBONATE AND ZEP ZORBENT, WEARING GOOGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVERSHIELD AND NITRILE GLOVES.

item.title: Report X-2024090761

item.title: Report E-2024090314
item.description:
Report E-2024090314

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NJV. It was reported that approximately half a gallon of TRANSCHEM Muriatic Acid released from a plastic jug due to improper loading. The release impacted inside of trailer #4653612. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed that 5-gallons of product was released impacting a 4' X 4' area of trailer floor and beneath the trailer. The contractor collected and containerized the TRANSCHEM Muriatic Acid and all clean-up debris into five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090296
item.description:
Report E-2024090296

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver failed to properly secure the loading lines at the shipper location. As a result, approximately 1300 pounds of molten sulfur was released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
